bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Cesar Rodriguez Exposito, February 22, 1952

div1.p: Hench thanks Rodriguez for the copy of his book on Finlay. Hench will have a translation made, and is sure he will find the information useful for his own research.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Cesar Rodriguez Exposito, February 22, 1952
div1.opener:
February 22, 1952
Senor Cesar Rodriguez
Exposito
Apartado 97
Habana, Cuba
My dear Senor Rodriguez:
div1.p:
Thank you very kindly for sending me your book on Finlay.
It looks very interesting indeed. My knowledge of Spanish is poor
but I shall have a translation made of it, or at least of parts of
it and I know it will be very useful indeed for me as I am writing
a book on the conquest of yellow fever and will of course want to
give my countrymen full knowledge of the great work of Finlay.
div1.closer: Sincerely yours, P. S. Hench, M.D. PSH:alc
